intro: Whittieria engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's whittieria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
